events.comment: * Objects are self-contained stuff that is placed around the level
* Debug

parameters:
"Door Angle: " + ToString(obj_doorCollision.Angle()) + " ; " + NewLine() + "Pivot Angle: " + ToString(obj_doorPivot.Angle()) + " ; " + NewLine() + "Is Linked: " + obj_doorCollision.isLinked + " ; " + NewLine() + "Direction: " + obj_doorCollision.cardinalDirections + " ; " + NewLine() + "Is Moving: " + obj_doorCollision.isMoving + " ; " + NewLine() + "Step: " + obj_doorCollision.openingStep + " ; " +
NewLine() +
"Is Locked: " + obj_doorCollision.key_isLocked + " ; "

"BARREL" + NewLine() +
"---" + NewLine() +
"Explosion Distance: " +
obj_barrel.explosion_distanceMin + " ; " +
obj_barrel.explosion_distanceMax + " ; " +
NewLine() +
"Explosion Strength: " +
obj_barrel.explosion_strengthMin + " ; " +
obj_barrel.explosion_strengthMax + " ; " +
NewLine() +
"---" + NewLine() +
"Health: " +
ToString(obj_barrel.Health::Health()) + " ; " +
NewLine() +
"Is Linked: " + obj_barrel.isLinked

"Health: " + ToString(obj_crate.Health::Health()) + " ; " + NewLine() +
"Explosion Distance: " + obj_crate.explosionDistance + " ; " + NewLine() +
"Explosion Strength: " + obj_crate.explosionStrength + " ; "

events.comment: * Group of functions to interact and open Door Objects, by using the direction of the angle in accordance with the Player Hitbox.

* Initialize

* Door works in conjunction with a custom Pivot object, which determines its angle and distance

* Determine the angle of Pivot in order to know in which Directions the Door should open; directions here refer to Editor viewport, so "Right" translates to North in-game
* Also changes the position of the Pivot so it fits inside the Door frame
* Link the Objects
* Set the initial variables, floor the Angle of the Objects
* Main Action to rotate Doors & Pivots

*** There's probably a better way to deal with all of this, but as it stands it needs a group of actions for each and every possible way in which the Doors can move, so four gigagroups for just two different ways... It's not scalable, not reusable, it's a clusterfuck but hey, it works! ***
* Before starting the movement, check if the Door needs to be unlocked with Keys
* Start by checking the Direction assigned of the Door
* Start by checking the Direction assigned of the Door
* Start by checking the Direction assigned of the Door
* Start by checking the Direction assigned of the Door
* Each 3D window model creates a 3D sprite inside of it, and hides the models afterward
* Define Opacity with a Tween number
* Apply Damage when hit by a high speed moving Physics Object
* Change animation and opacity to make the shattering effect when hit
* Change Animation when damaged
* Create and link FX for flames, starts at 0 to hide
* Initialize
* Place the particle to always follow the Barrel position
* Health of Barrel is <40, set on fire:  it gradually loses Health, and start a particle for the flames
* Check when Barrel is dead
* Check the distance between the Objects, and apply an explosion force to them. Also add a Damage in relation to the distance. Check the Formula up on the initialize action
*** BUG *** Does not apply to other Barrels, find a way to calculate them
ALSO DOES NOT WORK WHEN CHANGING LEVEL/RESPAWNING NEW BARRELS

parameters:
sqrt(
(obj_barrel.X() - obj_crate.X()) * (obj_barrel.X() - obj_crate.X())
+
(obj_barrel.Y() - obj_crate.Y()) * (obj_barrel.Y() - obj_crate.Y())
+
(obj_barrel.Object3D::Z() - obj_crate.Object3D::Z()) * (obj_barrel.Object3D::Z() - obj_crate.Object3D::Z())
)

sqrt(
(obj_barrel.X() - obj_glassBottle.X()) * (obj_barrel.X() - obj_glassBottle.X())
+
(obj_barrel.Y() - obj_glassBottle.Y()) * (obj_barrel.Y() - obj_glassBottle.Y())
+
(obj_barrel.Object3D::Z() - obj_glassBottle.Object3D::Z()) * (obj_barrel.Object3D::Z() - obj_glassBottle.Object3D::Z())
)

events.comment: * Make near Windows shatter
* Damage Enemies nearby

parameters:
sqrt(
(obj_barrel.X() - group_enemies.X()) * (obj_barrel.X() - group_enemies.X())
+
(obj_barrel.Y() - group_enemies.Y()) * (obj_barrel.Y() - group_enemies.Y())
+
(obj_barrel.Object3D::Z() - group_enemies.Object3D::Z()) * (obj_barrel.Object3D::Z() - group_enemies.Object3D::Z())
)

events.comment: * Damage the nearby Player

parameters:
sqrt(
(obj_barrel.X() - player_hitbox.X()) * (obj_barrel.X() - player_hitbox.X())
+
(obj_barrel.Y() - player_hitbox.Y()) * (obj_barrel.Y() - player_hitbox.Y())
+
(obj_barrel.Object3D::Z() - player_hitbox.Object3D::Z()) * (obj_barrel.Object3D::Z() - player_hitbox.Object3D::Z())
)

events.comment: * Change the Particle, make it a big explosion
* Stop the flaming sound, play Explosion
* Delete the Barrel
* Debug
* Start by initiating the Base Timer.
* Create an Object on top of any Bases. The kind of Object is determined by "pickup_type", and it link automatically when spawned.
* Healtpacks/Medikits
* Ammo Boxes
* Red Keys
* Blue Keys
* Green Keys
* Animate the Pickups. This is done with a sine wave calculation (thanks Bouh!)
* On Collision, add 50 Health Points to the Player. Does not activate if the Player is already at Max Health.
* If Respawn var is Activated, reset the Base Timer
* On Collision, refills the Ammo Reserve
* Check which Weapon is currently active
* If Respawn var is Activated, reset the Base Timer
* On Collision, add a coloured Keycard to the Player inventory

* If Respawn var is Activated, reset the Base Timer.

*** You should probably deactivate it for Keys, you don't want to spawn them more than one! ***
